description:
Onychostoma macrolepis is a species of freshwater fish belonging to the carp family, Cyprinidae. It is native to parts of China, primarily found in the Yangtze River basin.

Some key characteristics of Onychostoma macrolepis:

1. Body shape: It has a moderately elongated, somewhat compressed body shape.

2. Scales: The species is characterized by its relatively large scales, with the scales on the lateral line being particularly prominent.

3. Fins: It has a dorsal fin with a strong, serrated spine and an anal fin with 3 unbranched and 5 branched rays.

4. Mouth: The mouth is subterminal, with two pairs of short barbels.

5. Coloration: The upper body is typically olive-green or brownish, while the lower parts are lighter, often with a silvery or white hue.

6. Size: Onychostoma macrolepis can grow to a maximum length of around 40 centimeters (15.7 inches).

This species is found in medium to large-sized rivers and lakes within its native range in China. It plays a role in the local ecosystem as part of the freshwater fish community.
